sense.name: strenuous effort in pursuit of a goal
sense.commentary: STRUGGLE[+activity][+effort][+strenuous][+pursue][+goal] Note: refers to a goal state, does -not- imply a zero-sum outcome (Sense 3)
sense.examples: The book describes their arduous struggle for freedom from slavery. It was a struggle to make oneself heard above all the noise. Her struggles to become a ballerina did not succeed. The struggle to overcome AIDS and malaria will be a long one.

sense.name: a physical tussle
sense.commentary: STRUGGLE[+activity][+fight][+physical][+tussle] Note: refers to instance of a physical fight or tussle
sense.examples: The gun must have gone off during their struggle. The children's quarrel over the toy ended in a struggle on the floor.

sense.name: fierce contest, rivalry
sense.commentary: STRUGGLE[+contest][+zero_sum][+fierce] Note: implies winners and losers in the outcome (different from Sense 1)
sense.examples: A power struggle was going on among the highest-ranking political appointees. How many people did he step on in his struggle up the corporate ladder? The history of evolution is a struggle for survival of the fittest.
